hints.label: thm-fan-triangulation-error
hints.title: Fan Triangulation Error Bound
hints.content:
831: :label: thm-fan-triangulation-error
832: 
833: Let $\Sigma \subset (\mathcal{X}, g)$ be a smooth 2D surface with true Riemannian area $A_{\text{true}}$.
834: 
835: Let $C = (x_0, \ldots, x_{n-1})$ be a polygonal approximation of $\partial \Sigma$ with $n$ vertices and maximum edge length $h := \max_i \|x_{i+1} - x_i\|$.
836: 
837: Assume:
838: 1. Metric $g \in C^3(\Sigma)$
839: 2. Hausdorff distance $d_H(C, \partial \Sigma) \leq h$
840: 3. Surface curvature bounded: $\|K\|_\infty \leq K_{\max}$
841: 
842: Then the fan triangulation area $A_{\text{fan}}$ satisfies:
843: 
844: $$
845: |A_{\text{fan}} - A_{\text{true}}| \leq C \cdot h^2 \cdot (1 + K_{\max} A_{\text{true}})
846: $$
847: 
848: where $C$ depends on $\|g\|_{C^3}$ and $n$.
849: 
850: **Proof sketch:**
851: 1. Each triangle introduces error from replacing $g(x)$ with $g(x_c)$: $O(h^2 \|\nabla g\|)$
852: 2. Curvature of $\Sigma$ causes geometric error: $O(h^2 K_{\max})$
853: 3. Summing $n \sim h^{-1}$ triangles gives total error $O(h^2)$
hints.raw_directive:

hints.label: thm-monte-carlo-error-riemannian
hints.title: Monte Carlo Error for Riemannian Integrals
hints.content:
861: :label: thm-monte-carlo-error-riemannian
862: 
863: Let $I[f] = \int f(x) \sqrt{\det g(x)} \, dx$ and let $\{x_i\}_{i=1}^N$ be i.i.d. samples from $\rho \propto \sqrt{\det g} e^{-U/T}$.
864: 
865: The Monte Carlo estimator is:
866: 
867: $$
868: \hat{I}_N[f] := \frac{Z}{N} \sum_{i=1}^N f(x_i)
869: $$
870: 
871: where $Z$ is estimated separately.
872: 
873: **Error bound:** With probability $\geq 1 - \delta$:
874: 
875: $$
876: |I[f] - \hat{I}_N[f]| \leq \frac{\sigma[f]}{\sqrt{N}} \cdot t_{\alpha/2}
877: $$
878: 
879: where:
880: - $\sigma[f] := \sqrt{\text{Var}_\rho[f]}$ is standard deviation
881: - $t_{\alpha/2}$ is critical value for confidence level $1-\delta$
882: 
883: **Convergence rate:** $O(N^{-1/2})$ regardless of dimension (Monte Carlo advantage)
